conversation.message: Solve the equation: x(2x + 6) = 2(x² - 5).

First, expand both sides of the equation. On the left-hand side, expand x(2x + 6) to get 2x² + 6x. On the right-hand side, expand 2(x² - 5) to get 2x² - 10. This simplifies to: 2x² + 6x = 2x² - 10. Do you understand this step?
Yes.
Great! Subtract 2x² from both sides to get: 6x = -10. Divide both sides by 6 to solve for x: x = -10/6, which simplifies to x = -5/3. Do you understand this step?
